title: Find if Array Can Be Sorted
description: Given an array of integers, determine if it is possible to sort the array by removing at most one element. If the array can be sorted in non-decreasing order after removing one element, return true; otherwise, return false.
output_format: A boolean value indicating whether the array can be sorted by removing at most one element.

examples.explanation: Removing the element '4' results in [2, 3], which is sorted.
Removing any element does not result in a sorted array.
Removing the element '4' results in [3, 5, 2, 6], which can be sorted as [2, 3, 5, 6].

hints: Consider how the array behaves when you encounter a pair of elements that violate the non-decreasing order.
Check if the array becomes valid after removing the out-of-order element.
